result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter B. Boris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $1,800 plus costs totaling $3,214.00.  
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Participate in any counseling or assessment recommended by the agent.
Provide a DNA sample.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  Agent can use DOT Assessment if agent deems appropriate.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Peter B. Boris in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Peter B. Boris in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
All files heard: 15CF185, 15CF300, 15CF331, 15CF431

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF185 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF431 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Atty Halverson agrees this will be a 4th offense within 5 years of the 3rd offense. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF185 Count 1, 15CF431.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CF185 Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.
15CF300 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF331 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF185 Count 1 - 
Serve 36 months prison with 24 months Initial Confinement followed by 12 months Extended Supervision - STAYED -
Eligible for Earned Release program.
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months:
Serve 180 days jail with 4 days credit, consecutive to 15CF431.
Allowed to serve the second half on electronic monitor if he qualifies for that program after an assessment by the sheriff's department. 
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Pay $1,800 fine plus costs totaling $3,614.00.
Pay $26.45 blood draw fee. 
Revocation for 36 months. 
IID for 36 months. 
Obtain DOT Assessment and comply with safety plan. 
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. Agent can use DOT Assessment if agent deems appropriate.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Participate in any other counseling or assessment recommended by his agent. 
Provide a DNA sample. 

15CF431 - 
Serve 60 days jail. 
60 days credit. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

Defendant Peter B. Boris in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:17 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
